channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2025010083
item.description:
Report E-2025010083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1946 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at UVG. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Zep Acidic Toilet Bowl Cleaner released from 1-gallon plastic jugs due to improper loading by terminal UCU. The release impacted the inside of a small plastic carrier bin in trailer # 3213389. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Esther. Report #20241201200198. ERTS called Trenton back and he explained that the damaged box is by itself on the plastic carrier bin. He said the bin isn't something that they would need to salvage, and he has no problem disposing it. ERTS advised that since the product is contained to the bin, terminal personnel can place the bin in a 55-gallon poly waste drum themselves.
